<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>This being peak Christmas music season, we asked our coworkers for their thoughts on the best Christmas music <em>covers</em>. </p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Gaetane, engagement editor: Celine Dion’s “O Holy Night”</span></li>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Dan, senior editor: “Frosty the Snowman” from Cocteau Twins</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Jackie, senior director, brand partnerships: “Christmas Time Is Here” by Khruangbin</span></li>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Happy listening.</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/exxon-mobil-pledges-emission-cuts?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Exxon Gets a Trim
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Exxon green" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDIxL2V4eG9uX2dyZWVuLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Between the pandemic, a crash in oil prices, and growing calls to address its role in climate change, Exxon Mobil’s had plenty to reflect on this year. Yesterday, it got a headstart on New Year’s resolutions. By 2025, it's <a href="https://www.axios.com/exxon-new-emissions-curbs-a0045a5b-c3bf-471b-ab5d-64cba2277a27.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">aiming to</a>...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reduce overall emissions intensity by 15%–20%</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Halve methane emission intensity</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Emission “intensity”? </strong>Exxon’s commitments focus on emissions per unit of output, not absolute emissions. While these efforts should reduce total emissions, it’s not clear by how much, Axios writes. Additionally, Exxon is focusing on emissions linked to its own operations, not what’s known as “scope 3 emissions” released when its products are used (Exxon will begin reporting those next year). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Playing catchup</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Once the most valuable company in the world, Exxon’s market cap has fallen around 60% in the last decade, and it was booted from the Dow this summer. For years, investors have pressured the company to take action on the environment; last week, an <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/07/big-oil-laggard-exxon-faces-new-climate-threat-activist-investors.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">activist investor campaign</a> called for new directors.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They might like the example set by </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/unilever-to-give-investors-advisory-vote-on-climate-change-plan-11607971421?mod=hp_lista_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Unilever</a></span><span>, which this week became the first major company to voluntarily give shareholders advisory voting power on carbon reduction efforts.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Big picture: </strong>Oil companies, especially in the U.S., have been criticized for lagging behind the clean energy transition. While some are making efforts, including net-zero emissions targets and diversifying into renewables, “there doesn't seem to be an oil major that's got it all figured out between the pandemic, cloudy demand and price outlooks, and the unknown path through a world getting a bit more serious about climate,” <a href="https://www.axios.com/big-oil-exxon-climate-prices-569c0b77-51c2-4f15-8716-756668b66896.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Axios writes</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">One more bump in their path</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President-elect Joe Biden. He’s <a href="https://apnews.com/article/europe-climate-climate-change-paris-france-6e21f86b5c4affaee8ee04e870a1ea6c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pledged</a> to rejoin the Paris Accord on Day 1, invest $2 trillion in clean energy, and get the U.S. on a path to net-zero carbon emissions “no later than 2050.” </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">One way to get there:</strong></span><span> requiring businesses to report climate change risks and opportunities, which Mike Bloomberg pressed Biden to support in </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-14/the-world-needs-biden-to-lead-on-climate-disclosure?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">an op-ed</a></span><span> yesterday. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead…</strong>while fossil fuel companies struggle, a new guard of clean energy giants is beating them to investor dollars and ushering in energy’s “<a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-new-green-energy-giants-challenging-exxon-and-bp-meet-nextera-enel-11607696660?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NextEra</a>.”  </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/us-healthcare-workers-receive-first-covid-vaccines?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bittersweet Day
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Sandra Lindsay, left, a nurse at Long Island Jewish Medical Center, is inoculated with the COVID-19 vaccine by Dr. Michelle Chester, December 14, 2020 in the Queens borough of New York City." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDI0L2NvdmlkX3ZhY2NpbmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Lennihan - Pool/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, NYC-area nurse Sandra Lindsay (above) became the first American <a href="https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/amberjamieson/new-york-nurse-first-us-recipient-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vaccinated</a> against Covid-19 outside of clinical trials. Three million more doses of Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/first-covid19-vaccines-delivered?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will be delivered</a> across the country this week.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But just as that light at the end of the Lincoln Tunnel gets brighter, the short-term trajectory of the U.S.’ outbreak has never <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/12/14/world/covid-19-coronavirus?name=styln-coronavirus&region=TOP_BANNER&block=storyline_menu_recirc&action=click&pgtype=Interactive&impression_id=b1b3b400-3e42-11eb-82e3-69590ae70d8d&variant=1_Show#the-number-of-people-with-the-virus-who-died-in-the-us-passes-300000&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">looked so grim</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 300,000 Americans have died from Covid-19. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The U.S. is averaging around 200,000 new cases/day and 3,000+ deaths. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, NYC’s mayor told the city to prepare for a potential “full shutdown.” The city halted indoor dining as of yesterday, but will keep schools open.  </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Across the pond…</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things are also getting worse before they get better. <a href="https://apnews.com/article/international-news-england-london-coronavirus-pandemic-b6c78f2173016d7df2e6f4121091a2d6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">London</a>, the <a href="https://apnews.com/article/international-news-mark-rutte-netherlands-coronavirus-pandemic-restaurants-62f528f5c0350abcdeb20e6214e04cdb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Netherlands</a>, and <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/dec/14/italy-likely-to-follow-germany-with-covid-christmas-lockdown?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Italy</a> are following Germany and reimposing stricter lockdowns on nonessential businesses, travel, and social life through early January.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And while the UK began administering Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine last week, EU countries are <a href="https://www.politico.eu/article/pressure-mounts-on-eu-regulator-to-approve-coronavirus-vaccine-quickly/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still waiting</a> on the bloc’s regulatory body for approval. The longer process has drawn criticism from some European leaders. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/taking-look-fallout-solarwinds-hack?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Hackers Are in the Computer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Zoolander computer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/908fS3eQFUodG/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Zoolander computer" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/908fS3eQFUodG/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fortune 500 companies and government agencies in the U.S. and UK are doing some holiday deep cleaning on their software networks following a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-14/u-k-government-nato-join-u-s-in-monitoring-risk-from-hack?sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">major cybersecurity attack</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Hackers infiltrated the IT systems of several federal agencies and top corporations via a product made by software company SolarWinds. The hack was first identified <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/cybersecurity-giant-fireeye-suffers-massive-attack?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">last week</a> by FireEye, a cybersecurity company that itself was hacked. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">It ain’t good </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over 300,000 customers use SolarWinds, <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/12/14/russia-hack-us-government/?utm_source=feedly&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=wp_business&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">18,000</a> of which have been directly impacted, according to the company. It’s a small slice, but what the hackers sacrificed in quantity, they made up for in quality. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Known targets in the U.S. include the Treasury, Commerce, and Homeland Security Departments, according to the Washington Post. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As for the identity of the hackers, multiple outlets say all signs point to a specific group of <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-10/fireeye-hack-raises-the-specter-of-cozy-bear-and-more-cyber-insecurity?srnd=cybersecurity&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Russian state-backed hackers</a> called “APT29” or “Cozy Bear.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This attack has cybersecurity professionals rattled. FireEye believes the operation dates back to March, potentially giving the hackers access to sensitive data from U.S. elections and a vaccine development process that shattered records. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s get right to the promo: If you invest $5k in crypto using the world’s leading social trading platform, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/483368032;279358904;t" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">eToro</a>, you’ll get a $500 bonus.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You could use that money to copy the moves of top-performing traders on eToro using their CopyTrader™ tool. Or, with over a dozen cryptocurrencies available to trade, you can choose from options that are, like the bonus, quite numerous.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But the other thing you get when you <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/483368032;279358904;t" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">invest $5k on eToro</a> is access to their Club. You’ll get benefits like:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Higher staking rewards for select crypto</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Access to advanced trading products</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A sweet eToro swag bag</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The ability to say “Join the Club” unironically</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Again, let us be clear. <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/483368032;279358904;t" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Invest $5k in crypto on eToro and get a $500 bonus</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The way to do that, clearly, is by <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/483368032;279358904;t" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">clicking here</a>.*</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADULT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/pornhub-bows-pressure-deletes-unverified-videos?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Pornhub Bows to Pressure, Deletes Unverified Videos
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Late Sunday night, Pornhub said it would <a href="https://www.pornhub.com/blog/11422?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">remove all videos</a> on its site not created by its content partners or its Model Program members, then set out on a massive content purge that eliminated most of its library.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As of Monday afternoon, the site had 2.9 million videos, compared to 13.5 million on Sunday. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Earlier this month, Nicholas Kristof wrote in <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/04/opinion/sunday/pornhub-rape-trafficking.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a column</a> for the NYT that the platform was “infested with rape videos” and that it monetizes other types of sexual violence toward childen. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That piece set off a <a href="https://www.vice.com/en/article/jgqjjy/pornhub-suspended-all-unverified-videos-content?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chain of events</a> that have “left the porn industry shaken,” according to Motherboard. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mastercard and Visa, which process payments on the site, launched an investigation.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pornhub enacted policy changes, including banning unverified accounts from uploading new content. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But that wasn’t enough. Last Thursday, Mastercard and Visa cut ties with Pornhub.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pornhub says that it’s being unfairly targeted because it’s an adult content site and that its efforts to remove illegal content have been largely effective. But it failed to convince the powerful payment processors, whose decisions could lead to major changes in the porn industry.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/14/amazon-owned-zoox-unveils-autonomous-robotaxi?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Ultimate Riding Machine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="A blue Zoox autonomous robotaxi " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNDI1L3pvb3hfYXV0b25vbW91c19yb2JvdGF4aS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Zoox</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Amazon-owned Zoox unveiled its first <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/14/amazons-self-driving-company-zoox-unveils-autonomous-robotaxi.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">electric robotaxi</a> in its push to eliminate awkward small talk in Ubers forever. Here’s what’s under the hood.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s driverless:</strong></span><span> In fact, the vehicle doesn’t even have a steering wheel or pedals.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s safe:</strong></span><span> In the event of a crash, airbags </span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/zoox-driverless-autonomous-electric-vehicle-bc980691-4f20-4cad-9d15-c2b33ca5d7a8.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">envelop individual passengers</a></span><span> to prevent any painful knee-knocking in the four-person cabin.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">It’s fast(ish): </strong></span><span>Topping out at 75 mph, it’s the speediest robotaxi in the industry.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Zoox’s ties with Amazon mean it will likely be called into action to help optimize that last mile of delivery that keeps Bezos up at night. But for now, Zoox is 100% focused on people, not packages. “In a nutshell, we want to eventually move people around a city,” CEO Aicha Evans <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/14/opinion/Zoox-Amazon-self-driving.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> journalist Kara Swisher in an interview. “It’s purpose built.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line:</strong> Zoox is not yet ready for commercial use, but the ultimate goal is to launch a ride-sharing app in a few major cities.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today’s game is the brainchild of Brew reader Mark Bissell. Which reminds us—if you have an idea for a trivia question or a puzzle, definitely drop a line.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Okay, onto Mark’s puzzle. Picture a world in which M&As are only approved for companies whose names can be merged by blending one into another via shared letters.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In this world, we’ll give you a clue about the combined company and you have to determine the two companies that merged.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ex. Furniture for the Oracle of Omaha = Berkshire Hathawayfair </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>It has </span><span><em>Normal People</em></span><span>...and leggings</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A $1.6 trillion colossus with a Vision Fund</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>An electric automaker, but make it bubbly</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A defense contractor for singles </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Vegan house rentals</span></li>
</ol>

Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBetween the pandemic, a crash in oil prices, and growing calls to address its role in climate change, Exxon Mobil’s had plenty to reflect on this year. Yesterday, it got a headstart on New Year’s resolutions. By 2025, it's \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/exxon-new-emissions-curbs-a0045a5b-c3bf-471b-ab5d-64cba2277a27.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eaiming to\u003c/a\u003e...\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReduce overall emissions intensity by 15%–20%\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHalve methane emission intensity\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eEmission “intensity”? \u003c/strong\u003eExxon’s commitments focus on emissions per unit of output, not absolute emissions. While these efforts should reduce total emissions, it’s not clear by how much, Axios writes. Additionally, Exxon is focusing on emissions linked to its own operations, not what’s known as “scope 3 emissions” released when its products are used (Exxon will begin reporting those next year). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003ePlaying catchup\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOnce the most valuable company in the world, Exxon’s market cap has fallen around 60% in the last decade, and it was booted from the Dow this summer. For years, investors have pressured the company to take action on the environment; last week, an \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/12/07/big-oil-laggard-exxon-faces-new-climate-threat-activist-investors.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eactivist investor campaign\u003c/a\u003e called for new directors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThey might like the example set by \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/unilever-to-give-investors-advisory-vote-on-climate-change-plan-11607971421?mod=hp_lista_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eUnilever\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, which this week became the first major company to voluntarily give shareholders advisory voting power on carbon reduction efforts.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBig picture: \u003c/strong\u003eOil companies, especially in the U.S., have been criticized for lagging behind the clean energy transition. While some are making efforts, including net-zero emissions targets and diversifying into renewables, “there doesn't seem to be an oil major that's got it all figured out between the pandemic, cloudy demand and price outlooks, and the unknown path through a world getting a bit more serious about climate,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/big-oil-exxon-climate-prices-569c0b77-51c2-4f15-8716-756668b66896.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eAxios writes\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eOne more bump in their path\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePresident-elect Joe Biden. He’s \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/europe-climate-climate-change-paris-france-6e21f86b5c4affaee8ee04e870a1ea6c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epledged\u003c/a\u003e to rejoin the Paris Accord on Day 1, invest $2 trillion in clean energy, and get the U.S. on a path to net-zero carbon emissions “no later than 2050.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eOne way to get there:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e requiring businesses to report climate change risks and opportunities, which Mike Bloomberg pressed Biden to support in \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-14/the-world-needs-biden-to-lead-on-climate-disclosure?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ean op-ed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e yesterday. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead…\u003c/strong\u003ewhile fossil fuel companies struggle, a new guard of clean energy giants is beating them to investor dollars and ushering in energy’s “\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/the-new-green-energy-giants-challenging-exxon-and-bp-meet-nextera-enel-11607696660?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, NYC-area nurse Sandra Lindsay (above) became the first American \u003ca href=\"https://www.buzzfeednews.com/article/amberjamieson/new-york-nurse-first-us-recipient-covid-19-vaccine?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" Three million more doses of Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/13/first-covid19-vaccines-delivered?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewill be delivered\u003c/a\u003e across the country this week.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut just as that light at the end of the Lincoln Tunnel gets brighter, the short-term trajectory of the U.S.’ outbreak has never \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/live/2020/12/14/world/covid-19-coronavirus?name=styln-coronavirus\u0026region=TOP_BANNER\u0026block=storyline_menu_recirc\u0026action=click\u0026pgtype=Interactive\u0026impression_id=b1b3b400-3e42-11eb-82e3-69590ae70d8d\u0026variant=1_Show#the-number-of-people-with-the-virus-who-died-in-the-us-passes-300000\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elooked so grim\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 300,000 Americans have died from Covid-19. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe U.S. is averaging around 200,000 new cases/day and 3,000+ deaths. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, NYC’s mayor told the city to prepare for a potential “full shutdown.” The city halted indoor dining as of yesterday, but will keep schools open.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAcross the pond…\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings are also getting worse before they get better. \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/international-news-england-london-coronavirus-pandemic-b6c78f2173016d7df2e6f4121091a2d6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eLondon\u003c/a\u003e, the \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/international-news-mark-rutte-netherlands-coronavirus-pandemic-restaurants-62f528f5c0350abcdeb20e6214e04cdb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNetherlands\u003c/a\u003e, and \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/world/2020/dec/14/italy-likely-to-follow-germany-with-covid-christmas-lockdown?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eItaly\u003c/a\u003e are following Germany and reimposing stricter lockdowns on nonessential businesses, travel, and social life through early January.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAnd while the UK began administering Pfizer-BioNTech’s vaccine last week, EU countries are \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.eu/article/pressure-mounts-on-eu-regulator-to-approve-coronavirus-vaccine-quickly/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill waiting\u003c/a\u003e on the bloc’s regulatory body for approval. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nThe Hackers Are in the style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eFortune 500 companies and government agencies in the U.S. and UK are doing some holiday deep cleaning on their software networks following a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-12-14/u-k-government-nato-join-u-s-in-monitoring-risk-from-hack?sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emajor cybersecurity attack\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eHackers infiltrated the IT systems of several federal agencies and top corporations via a product made by software company SolarWinds. The hack was first identified \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/12/08/cybersecurity-giant-fireeye-suffers-massive-attack?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elast week\u003c/a\u003e by FireEye, a cybersecurity company that itself was hacked. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eIt ain’t good \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOver 300,000 customers use SolarWinds, \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/technology/2020/12/14/russia-hack-us-government/?utm_source=feedly\u0026utm_medium=referral\u0026utm_campaign=wp_business\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e18,000\u003c/a\u003e of which have been directly impacted, according to the company. It’s a small slice, but what the hackers sacrificed in quantity, they made up for in quality. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eKnown targets in the U.S. include the Treasury, Commerce, and Homeland Security Departments, according to the Washington Post. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs for the identity of the hackers, multiple outlets say all signs point to a specific group of \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/opinion/articles/2020-12-10/fireeye-hack-raises-the-specter-of-cozy-bear-and-more-cyber-insecurity?srnd=cybersecurity\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eRussian state-backed hackers\u003c/a\u003e called “APT29” or “Cozy Bear.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThis attack has cybersecurity professionals rattled. FireEye believes the operation dates back to March, potentially giving the hackers access to sensitive data from U.S. elections and a vaccine development process that shattered records. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLate Sunday night, Pornhub said it would \u003ca href=\"https://www.pornhub.com/blog/11422?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eremove all videos\u003c/a\u003e on its site not created by its content partners or its Model Program members, then set out on a massive content purge that eliminated most of its library.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs of Monday afternoon, the site had 2.9 million videos, compared to 13.5 million on Sunday. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eEarlier this month, Nicholas Kristof wrote in \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/04/opinion/sunday/pornhub-rape-trafficking.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ea column\u003c/a\u003e for the NYT that the platform was “infested with rape videos” and that it monetizes other types of sexual violence toward childen. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat piece set off a \u003ca href=\"https://www.vice.com/en/article/jgqjjy/pornhub-suspended-all-unverified-videos-content?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echain of events\u003c/a\u003e that have “left the porn industry shaken,” according to Motherboard. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMastercard and Visa, which process payments on the site, launched an investigation.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePornhub enacted policy changes, including banning unverified accounts from uploading new content. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut that wasn’t enough. Last Thursday, Mastercard and Visa cut ties with Pornhub.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePornhub says that it’s being unfairly targeted because it’s an adult content site and that its efforts to remove illegal content have been largely effective. Here’s what’s under the hood.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s driverless:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e In fact, the vehicle doesn’t even have a steering wheel or pedals.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s safe:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e In the event of a crash, airbags \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/zoox-driverless-autonomous-electric-vehicle-bc980691-4f20-4cad-9d15-c2b33ca5d7a8.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eenvelop individual passengers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to prevent any painful knee-knocking in the four-person cabin.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eIt’s fast(ish): \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTopping out at 75 mph, it’s the speediest robotaxi in the industry.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eZoox’s ties with Amazon mean it will likely be called into action to help optimize that last mile of delivery that keeps Bezos up at night. But for now, Zoox is 100% focused on people, not packages. “In a nutshell, we want to eventually move people around a city,” CEO Aicha Evans \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/14/opinion/Zoox-Amazon-self-driving.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e journalist Kara Swisher in an interview. “It’s purpose built.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line:\u003c/strong\u003e Zoox is not yet ready for commercial use, but the ultimate goal
